Families, please read the SPS RN Team Newsletter for September 2020. You will see information about:

- When to Stay Home
- Mask Requirements
- COVID Testing Sites
- Members of the SPS RN Team
- Farewells and Welcomes to the RN Team
- Information about Physical Exams, Medication (or special health care need) in School, and the Influenza Vaccine.

The Newsletter can be translated into your preferred language. Look for the black box at the top on the right side.

https://www.smore.com/ytxmu-sps-rn-team-newsletter

-

Leia o boletim informativo da equipe SPS RN de setembro de 2020. Você verá informações sobre:
- Quando ficar em casa
- Requisitos de máscara
- Locais de teste COVID
- Membros da equipe SPS RN
- Despedidas e boas-vindas à equipe RN
- Informações sobre exames físicos, medicamentos (ou necessidade de cuidados de saúde especiais) na escola, e a vacina contra influenza.
O boletim informativo pode ser traduzido para o idioma de sua preferência. Procure a caixa preta na parte superior do lado direito.

https://www.smore.com/ytxmu-sps-rn-team-newsletter

Please save this information in case you need it this school year.

Chromebook Technical Support
If your chromebook is broken or not working, submit a ticket at the following website: http://spstechhelp.com

Please leave your first and last name along with your phone number in case someone needs to call you regarding your child’s chromebook issue.

Login Help
If you don’t know what your student's login is, go to http://spstechhelp.com

-

Guarde esta informação para o caso de precisar neste ano letivo.

Suporte Técnico para Chromebook
Se o seu Chromebook estiver quebrado ou não funcionar, envie um tíquete no seguinte site: http://spstechhelp.com

Deixe seu nome e sobrenome junto com seu número de telefone, caso alguém precise ligar para você sobre o problema do Chromebook de seu filho.

Ajuda de login
Se você não souber qual é o login do seu aluno, vá para http://spstechhelp.com

link:
Stoughton High School has counselors available for those who may need or want help or any type of assistance surrounding the loss. Along with our partners at the Stoughton Youth Commission, counselors will be available today outside SHS for both student and staff support. SHS counselors will also be available through the beginning of school next week.

Students should also check their email about the details of a virtual meeting from 11am-1pm today.

post_text:
Bus postcards were mailed out last Friday and Tuesday to families who signed up online for the bus. Students must have the postcard with them to show the driver when they board the bus. If you did not get a postcard and you signed your student up for bus transportation, please contact Leanne Kerman at l_kerman@stoughtonschools.org.

We only have 23 students per bus so if your student does not have the postcard, they will not be able to ride the bus!!

If you did not sign up online, you can do so at stoughtontransportation.com and your student will be on the waiting list.

-

post_text:
Dear SPS Community,

It is with deep regret that I write to inform you about a recent loss to our school community. Sadly, Emily Carreiro, a member of the class of 2021, passed away unexpectedly today. Ms. Miller, High School Principal, describes Emily as “a generous, compassionate, extremely talented, bright young lady in our community. She always had a smile on her face and a kind word to share. This loss will be felt by many and Emily will be greatly missed.”

Stoughton Public Schools (and each building) has a Crisis Intervention Team made up of professionals trained to help with the needs of students, parents, and school personnel at difficult times such as this. At Stoughton High…

post_text:
Dear Parents/Guardians,

The USDA Extended Universal Free Meals, breakfast and lunch, to all students through December 31, 2020

During the Hybrid Learning Mode, the Stoughton Public Schools will be distributing meals for SPS students every Wednesday from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM for the Monday/Tuesday Cohort (A) and all fully remote students. Students, who attend school on Thursday/Friday (Cohort B), will pick up their meals Monday morning from 8:45 to 9:30 AM. Note the change in time.

Students who are fully remote will be entitled to five breakfast and five lunch meals on Wednesdays. Students, who are attending two days a week, will receive three breakfast and three lunch meals per week.

All…

Dear Parents/Guardians,

The USDA Extended Universal Free Meals, breakfast and lunch, to all students through December 31, 2020

During the Hybrid Learning Mode, the Stoughton Public Schools will be distributing meals for SPS students every Wednesday from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM for the Monday/Tuesday Cohort (A) and all fully remote students. Students, who attend school on Thursday/Friday (Cohort B), will pick up their meals Monday morning from 8:45 to 9:30 AM. Note the change in time.

Students who are fully remote will be entitled to five breakfast and five lunch meals on Wednesdays. Students, who are attending two days a week, will receive three breakfast and three lunch meals per week.

Good Morning Stoughton High School students,

If you would like to be assigned a locker for the start of this year please send me an email once you have acquired a combination lock. In the email please include your name, grade and what your combination is. Students who send this info will be sent an email with their locker number and location prior to the first day of school.

Look forward to seeing you all soon,
Mr. Small
Dean of Discipline
Stoughton High School
d_small@stoughtonschools.org
-
Bom dia, alunos da Stoughton High School,

Se vocês gostariam de ter um armário no início deste ano, envie-me um e-mail assim que tiver adquirido um cadeado com combinação. No e-mail, inclua seu nome, nota e qual é a sua combinação. Os alunos que enviarem essas informações receberão um e-mail com o número do armário e a localização antes do primeiro dia de aula.

Esperamos vê-los em breve,
Sr. Pequeno
Reitor da Disciplina
Stoughton High School
d_small@stoughtonschools.org

post_text:
Bus postcards were mailed out last Friday and Tuesday to families who signed up online for the bus. Students must have the postcard with them to show the driver when they board the bus. If you did not get a postcard and you signed your student up for bus transportation, please contact Leanne Kerman at l_kerman@stoughtonschools.org.

We only have 23 students per bus so if your student does not have the postcard, they will not be able to ride the bus!!

If you did not sign up online, you can do so at stoughtontransportation.com and your student will be on the waiting list.

-

post_text:
Dear Parents/Guardians,

The USDA Extended Universal Free Meals, breakfast and lunch, to all students through December 31, 2020

During the Hybrid Learning Mode, the Stoughton Public Schools will be distributing meals for SPS students every Wednesday from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM for the Monday/Tuesday Cohort (A) and all fully remote students. Students, who attend school on Thursday/Friday (Cohort B), will pick up their meals Monday morning from 8:45 to 9:30 AM. Note the change in time.

Students who are fully remote will be entitled to five breakfast and five lunch meals on Wednesdays. Students, who are attending two days a week, will receive three breakfast and three lunch meals per week.

All…
text:
Dear Parents/Guardians,

The USDA Extended Universal Free Meals, breakfast and lunch, to all students through December 31, 2020

During the Hybrid Learning Mode, the Stoughton Public Schools will be distributing meals for SPS students every Wednesday from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM for the Monday/Tuesday Cohort (A) and all fully remote students. Students, who attend school on Thursday/Friday (Cohort B), will pick up their meals Monday morning from 8:45 to 9:30 AM. Note the change in time.

Students who are fully remote will be entitled to five breakfast and five lunch meals on Wednesdays. Students, who are attending two days a week, will receive three breakfast and three lunch meals per week.

Dear Parents/Guardians,

During the Hybrid Learning Mode, the Stoughton Public Schools will be distributing meals for SPS students every Wednesday from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM for the Monday/Tuesday Cohort (A) and all fully remote students. Students who attend school on Thursday/Friday (Cohort B), will pick up their meals Monday morning from 8:30 to 9:30 AM.

All meals will be picked up at your child's school at a designated location, to be announced shortly.

Students who are fully remote will be entitled to five breakfast and five lunch meals on Wednesdays. Students who are attending two days a week, will receive three breakfast and three lunch meals per week.

Tables will be set up at the…
text:
Dear Parents/Guardians,

During the Hybrid Learning Mode, the Stoughton Public Schools will be distributing meals for SPS students every Wednesday from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM for the Monday/Tuesday Cohort (A) and all fully remote students. Students who attend school on Thursday/Friday (Cohort B), will pick up their meals Monday morning from 8:30 to 9:30 AM.

All meals will be picked up at your child's school at a designated location, to be announced shortly.

Students who are fully remote will be entitled to five breakfast and five lunch meals on Wednesdays. Students who are attending two days a week, will receive three breakfast and three lunch meals per week.

Dear Parents/Guardians:

The Stoughton Elementary School Principals send you greetings. As we move forward through these unprecedented times, we realize that communication with our school community is vital. For this reason, the SPS Elementary School Principals will be offering virtual presentations for our kindergarten and new students during the week of August 31st. During these presentations, Elementary Principals will be virtually presenting and ready to discuss what the start of the school year will look like at each school. The chat feature during each presentation will be available so that families can submit their comments and questions.

We know there are still many questions about…
text:
Dear Parents/Guardians:

The Stoughton Elementary School Principals send you greetings. As we move forward through these unprecedented times, we realize that communication with our school community is vital. For this reason, the SPS Elementary School Principals will be offering virtual presentations for our kindergarten and new students during the week of August 31st. During these presentations, Elementary Principals will be virtually presenting and ready to discuss what the start of the school year will look like at each school. The chat feature during each presentation will be available so that families can submit their comments and questions.

Please save this information in case you need it this school year.

Chromebook Technical Support
If your chromebook is broken or not working, submit a ticket at the following website: http://spstechhelp.com

Please leave your first and last name along with your phone number in case someone needs to call you regarding your child’s chromebook issue.

Login Help
If you don’t know what your student's login is, go to http://spstechhelp.com

-

Guarde esta informação para o caso de precisar neste ano letivo.

Suporte Técnico para Chromebook
Se o seu Chromebook estiver quebrado ou não funcionar, envie um tíquete no seguinte site: http://spstechhelp.com

Deixe seu nome e sobrenome junto com seu número de telefone, caso alguém precise ligar para você sobre o problema do Chromebook de seu filho.

Ajuda de login
Se você não souber qual é o login do seu aluno, vá para http://spstechhelp.com

shared_text:
O'Donnell Middle School Chromebook & information pickup is Tuesday, September 1 and Wednesday, September 2, 2020, from 8:30am-2:30pm.

We have a new Chromebook for every student, assigned by name. It is not a first come, first served situation, so there is no need to make an appointment or rush to get here first thing on the first day unless that truly is the best time for you. Just pick the time that's best for you, park in the lot, and come to the main entrance with your masks on.

-

O Chromebook da O'Donnell Middle School e a coleta de informações são terça-feira, 1º de setembro e quarta-feira, 2 de setembro de 2020, das 8h30 às 14h30.

Temos um novo Chromebook para cada aluno, atribuído pelo nome. Não é uma situação por ordem de chegada, então não há necessidade de marcar uma consulta ou se apressar para chegar aqui logo no primeiro dia, a menos que seja realmente o melhor momento para você. Basta escolher o melhor horário para você, estacionar no estacionamento e chegar à entrada principal com suas máscaras.

Dear Stoughton High School Marching Black Knights,

Looking forward to the FIRST meeting of our remote marching band this afternoon starting at 4pm!

Check your Google Classroom for announcements, updates, and important information.

Flu Shots are available for Stoughton families (children must be age 9 and over) & employees on Friday, September 4, 2020 from 8 AM to 1 PM at the Dawe School, located at 131 Pine Street, Stoughton MA.

Flu Shots are available for Stoughton families (children must be age 9 and over) & employees on Friday, September 4, 2020 from 8 AM to 1 PM at the Dawe School, located at 131 Pine Street, Stoughton MA.

Advance sign up required. Sign up for appointments, complete necessary documents, and receive email reminders about the vaccine clinic. Bring insurance cards and filled out your paperwork to save time.

For Friday, September 4, 2020, click here:

https://www.cvs.com/vaccine/intake/clinic/vaccine-select?clinicID=F2C76DF7CAEC510740E1E47DC2E3A601

If you have any questions, contact CVS Pharmacy #17332 in Stoughton at 781-847–4003.

Special Education families,

I am co-hosting a Q and A Forum on Wednesday, September 2, 2020 at 4:00pm with Ms. Carolyn Campbell, the President of our SEPAC; Special Education Parent Advisory Council. In addition, I am happy to announce that Ms. Amy Saraiva (Assistant Administrator of Special Education), Mrs. Bethany Furey (District BCBA) and Mrs. Danielle Gallan, Director of SPS Nurses will also be joining us.

Below is a survey that will allow you to write in any questions you may have regarding the return to school and add your email so that you can be invited to the google classroom meet either by video or phone. We will shut down the correspondence on Monday, September 1, 2020 at 4:00 to…

post_text:
Dear Parents/Guardians:

The Stoughton Elementary School Principals send you greetings. As we move forward through these unprecedented times, we realize that communication with our school community is vital. For this reason, the SPS Elementary School Principals will be offering virtual presentations for our kindergarten and new students during the week of August 31st. During these presentations, Elementary Principals will be virtually presenting and ready to discuss what the start of the school year will look like at each school. The chat feature during each presentation will be available so that families can submit their comments and questions.

We know there are still many questions about…
text:
Dear Parents/Guardians:

The Stoughton Elementary School Principals send you greetings. As we move forward through these unprecedented times, we realize that communication with our school community is vital. For this reason, the SPS Elementary School Principals will be offering virtual presentations for our kindergarten and new students during the week of August 31st. During these presentations, Elementary Principals will be virtually presenting and ready to discuss what the start of the school year will look like at each school. The chat feature during each presentation will be available so that families can submit their comments and questions.

post_text:
Dear Stoughton Public School Elementary Community!

We are looking forward to the school year beginning! We are aware there were some technical problems with the cohort assignment information that went out yesterday. If you did not receive an email with your cohort assignment, please contact your building principal (contact info below).

Please note cohorts have been solidified and aside from extenuating circumstances, we are unable to make changes.

Clarification about Cohort C: The 4 days a week in person schooling is reserved for Special Education students who attend school in a substantially separate classroom.

The Cohorts A and B are set up to ensure that no more than 12 students are in…

post_text:
Bus Information 2020-2021

Now that we have our plans in place for the fall, we have made some revisions to our bus fee payments.

The bus fee will now be split in two payments for 2020-2021:

For families choosing the hybrid model - The bus fee for September 14 – January 29 is $76.00.

- If your child is registered for the bus and you have not paid yet, your payment MUST be received by September 1 for your child to remain on the bus. You can pay online at SchoolCafe.com or by cash, bank check or money order at the District Office, 31 Pierce Street.

- If you have paid your bus fee already and are still planning on your child(ren) taking the bus you will be refunded $284.00 per child. The…

post_text:
Bus Information 2020-2021

Now that we have our plans in place for the fall, we have made some revisions to our bus fee payments.

The bus fee will now be split in two payments for 2020-2021:

For families choosing the hybrid model - The bus fee for September 14 – January 29 is $76.00.

- If your child is registered for the bus and you have not paid yet, your payment MUST be received by September 1 for your child to remain on the bus. You can pay online at SchoolCafe.com or by cash, bank check or money order at the District Office, 31 Pierce Street.

- If you have paid your bus fee already and are still planning on your child(ren) taking the bus you will be refunded $284.00 per child. The…

Please note cohorts have been solidified and aside from extenuating circumstances, we are unable to make changes.

shared_text:
O'Donnell Middle School Chromebook & information pickup is Tuesday, September 1 and Wednesday, September 2, 2020, from 8:30am-2:30pm.

We have a new Chromebook for every student, assigned by name. It is not a first come, first served situation, so there is no need to make an appointment or rush to get here first thing on the first day unless that truly is the best time for you. Just pick the time that's best for you, park in the lot, and come to the main entrance with your masks on.

-

O Chromebook da O'Donnell Middle School e a coleta de informações são terça-feira, 1º de setembro e quarta-feira, 2 de setembro de 2020, das 8h30 às 14h30.

Temos um novo Chromebook para cada aluno, atribuído pelo nome. Não é uma situação por ordem de chegada, então não há necessidade de marcar uma consulta ou se apressar para chegar aqui logo no primeiro dia, a menos que seja realmente o melhor momento para você. Basta escolher o melhor horário para você, estacionar no estacionamento e chegar à entrada principal com suas máscaras.

post_text:
Dear Parents/Guardians:

The Stoughton Elementary School Principals send you greetings. As we move forward through these unprecedented times, we realize that communication with our school community is vital. For this reason, the SPS Elementary School Principals will be offering virtual presentations for our kindergarten and new students during the week of August 31st. During these presentations, Elementary Principals will be virtually presenting and ready to discuss what the start of the school year will look like at each school. The chat feature during each presentation will be available so that families can submit their comments and questions.

We know there are still many questions about…

post_text:
Bus Information 2020-2021

Now that we have our plans in place for the fall, we have made some revisions to our bus fee payments.

The bus fee will now be split in two payments for 2020-2021:

For families choosing the hybrid model - The bus fee for September 14 – January 29 is $76.00.

- If your child is registered for the bus and you have not paid yet, your payment MUST be received by September 1 for your child to remain on the bus. You can pay online at SchoolCafe.com or by cash, bank check or money order at the District Office, 31 Pierce Street.

- If you have paid your bus fee already and are still planning on your child(ren) taking the bus you will be refunded $284.00 per child. The…

Flu Shots are available for Stoughton families & employees on Friday, August 28 & Friday, September 4, 2020 from 8 AM to 1 PM at the Dawe School, located at 131 Pine Street, Stoughton MA.

Advance sign up required. Sign up for appointments, complete necessary documents, and receive email reminders about the vaccine clinic. Bring insurance cards and filled out your paperwork to save time.

For Friday, August 28, 2020, click here:

https://www.cvs.com/vaccine/intake/clinic/vaccine-select?clinicID=8A6CA997839EEDE3C8B4DF1F36FD21E2

For Friday, September 4, 2020, click here:

https://www.cvs.com/vaccine/intake/clinic/vaccine-select?clinicID=F2C76DF7CAEC510740E1E47DC2E3A601

If you have any questions, contact CVS Pharmacy #17332 in Stoughton at 781-847–4003.

Skilled entrepreneurs have the vision to identify an opportunity, the knowledge of when to act, and the tenacity to overcome obstacles along the way. Good Monday Morning! Thank you to so many of you for filling out the Learning Mode Choice form over the course of last week! We have received responses for just over 3000 students!

While we are now able to begin forming cohorts, classes, and courses, we are still about 500 shy of the total number, so we are not able to complete the job and get families important information about the fall reopening.

This morning, our wonderful building secretaries are going through all of the results that came in Friday after noon. Once collated, we will make one more attempt to reach out to families who haven’t responded. Any students without a response will be put into a Hybrid Cohort group.

We are…

Dear Parent/Guardian,
>>>>>>> master

If you have not already done so, please fill out this form for each of your children by this Friday, August 14, 2020. It is extremely important that all families respond so we can place students in the correct mode (hybrid or virtual). To be clear, all children who do not have a completed form will be placed in the hybrid model and in a cohort initially based on alphabet.

https://forms.gle/Fsoa24kW6r2jFLVR7

Thank you for your prompt attention.

Dr. Marcus, Superintendent

More information is available here:

https://www.stoughtonschools.org/district/news/fall-reopening-update-august-10-2020

Dear Parent/Guardian,

If you have not already done so, please fill out this form for each of your children by this Friday, August 14, 2020. It is extremely important that all families respond so we can place students in the correct mode (hybrid or virtual). To be clear, all children who do not have a completed form will be placed in the hybrid model and in a cohort initially based on alphabet.

https://forms.gle/Fsoa24kW6r2jFLVR7

Thank you for your prompt attention.

Dr. Marcus, Superintendent

More information is available here:

https://www.stoughtonschools.org/district/news/fall-reopening-update-august-10-2020

post_text:
Massachusetts state public health officials announced the 2020 season’s first EEE positive mosquito sample.

The best way to prevent EEE is to prevent attracting mosquitoes and mosquito bites. The recommendation is to wear long sleeved shirts, pants and socks when outdoors. Use a repellent with DEET, and remove all areas of standing water. If going to a town where EEE has been detected, avoid being outside from dusk until dawn whenever possible.

More information can be found on the websites below:
https://www.mass.gov/service-details/eee-eastern-equine-encephalitis
http://www.mosquitoresults.com/

post_text:
Dear SPS Families-

As mentioned in my update on Saturday, our plan to provide a hybrid mode and virtual modes of instruction in the fall was voted by the School Committee last week. While we are still in negotiations with our unions, we are hoping to start to clarify student learning mode choices, provide more information, and offer additional opportunities for questions and answers.

Family Learning Mode Choice

Most importantly, we need to understand each family's choices for their students’ learning mode this fall. Please go to this LINK to choose your students’ learning mode to the best of your ability. We ask that the form is completed by this Friday, August 14, 2020.

post_text:
Fall Reopening Update

Dear SPS Community,

At Thursday night's School Committee meeting, we discussed our district’s return to school in the fall. Dr. Marcus shared the three contingency plans and then presented a proposal outlining administration’s recommendation for a Hybrid model combined with a choice of fully remote learning.

In this model, K-12 students in the Hybrid mode will go to school on two consecutive days (Monday and Tuesday, or Thursday and Friday) and have a special set of remote experiences on Wednesdays. Students who are fully remote would be a part of the Elementary Virtual Academy, a structure that allows for more synchronous, robust remote experiences, or a Secondary…
text:
Fall Reopening Update

Dear SPS Community,

At Thursday night's School Committee meeting, we discussed our district’s return to school in the fall. Dr. Marcus shared the three contingency plans and then presented a proposal outlining administration’s recommendation for a Hybrid model combined with a choice of fully remote learning.

In this model, K-12 students in the Hybrid mode will go to school on two consecutive days (Monday and Tuesday, or Thursday and Friday) and have a special set of remote experiences on Wednesdays. Students who are fully remote would be a part of the Elementary Virtual Academy, a structure that allows for more synchronous, robust remote experiences, or a Secondary…

A reminder that the start of fall preseason has been delayed by the MIAA until 9/14 because of the pandemic. Do your part in practicing physical distance.

Please stay off campus fields until proper supervision within seasons can be provided. Mask Up!

post_text:
Dear SPS Community,

We hope you are all well and staying healthy!

We would like to take this opportunity to provide additional information regarding the Fall 2020 school reopening. Our planning process continues to be guided by a clear focus on the health and safety of our students, staff and families. At this time, we have submitted three contingency plans to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE) as possibilities for learning in the Stoughton Public Schools beginning in September. These plans were developed over the past several weeks in consultation with a number of key stakeholders in the district. Input from staff, parents/guardians, and the community was… More

Skilled entrepreneurs have the vision to identify an opportunity, the knowledge of when to act, and the tenacity to overcome obstacles along the way. Shark Tank is a TV show that pairs entrepreneurship with innovation! Watch an episode of Shark Tank below. As you watch, think about what products the sharks invest in. Why? What products did the sharks reject?

SUMMER NUTRITION PROGRAM at the O’DONNELL MIDDLE SCHOOL

The Stoughton Public Schools will be offering a Summer Nutrition Program at the Dr. Robert G. O’Donnell Middle School, at 211 Cushing Street in Stoughton, from Monday - Thursday, July 6 through August 6, 2020, free of charge, to all Stoughton children, 18 and under.

Children not enrolled in the summer educational program may pick up breakfast and lunch in front of the O'Donnell Middle School from 10:00 - 11:00 AM.

CDC regulations do not allow anyone that isn't associated with the educational summer program to enter the building. This is true for parents of the children at drop off and pick up, for the safety of our students…

Dear Parents/Guardians:

The Stoughton Elementary School Principals send you greetings and assurances that we are working together daily on the reopening of school for September. As you know, the proposed plans, options and scenarios are varied and dependent upon a number of factors. The final decision will be announced within a couple weeks.

We realize how difficult it is to not know exact information in order to plan for your child (ren), your own life, and work commitments. We continue to be committed along with Dr. Marcus, Superintendent of Schools, in planning to meet the needs of all students and teachers to be in a safe and healthy learning environment.

post_text:
Here is more information about the MIAA and school athletics this fall (at this time).

MIAA calls timeout
State’s governing body for high school sports delays start of fall season until Sept. 14

By Eric McHugh, THE PATRIOT LEDGER, July 22, 2020

California on Monday pushed its 2020 high school football season all the way back to the spring.

Massachusetts isn’t following suit right now, but all fall sports around here, assuming they can be played, will be delayed.

On Tuesday, the MIAA’s Board of Directors unanimously approved a recommendation by the association’s COVID-19 Task Force to delay until Sept. 14 the start of all fall sports. Those sports first must be given the OK to be played by…

Knights Walk will also be continuing into September.

Technology punch to be completed by 7/29

SUMMER NUTRITION PROGRAM at the O’DONNELL MIDDLE SCHOOL

The Stoughton Public Schools will be offering a Summer Nutrition Program at the Dr. Robert G. O’Donnell Middle School, at 211 Cushing Street in Stoughton, from Monday - Thursday, July 6 through August 6, 2020, free of charge, to all Stoughton children, 18 and under.

Children not enrolled in the summer educational program may pick up breakfast and lunch in front of the O'Donnell Middle School from 10:00 - 11:00 AM.

CDC regulations do not allow anyone that isn't associated with the educational summer program to enter the building. This is true for parents of the children at drop off and pick up, for the safety of our students…

post_text:
In case you missed it, here is the Reopening Survey Dr. Marcus sent out yesterday for parents/guardians to provide important feedback on our Fall Reopening.

English / Portuguese: https://forms.gle/TusYmYnwryrNgkrd6

Haitian Creole: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdbRFHkIUGvmwV3v-SEdJFqs5eWVAvrnLSAD_VrMvlY8hMTvQ/viewform

The survey is broken up into three sections, one for each of the three models that we need to provide to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education by the end of the month. While there are some descriptions of each model built into the survey, it is not meant to provide details of each model as those are being developed now and with your input. Your feedback is neither a vote nor a commitment, but an opportunity for you to hear a little about each model and then share thoughts or questions with the team to help us make the best choice for the Stoughton Public Schools Fall Reopening Plan.

post_id:
Check out the July SPS Rube Goldberg Challenge and Contest!

Design a Rube-Goldberg Machine that uses multiple steps to complete a simple task. The basic concept that we’re exploring is that of a chain reaction. This open-ended challenge employs the engineering design process.

Get inspired, solve a problem, gather supplies, design and build your machine. Learn more here:

https://sites.google.com/stoughtonschools.org/spssummerlearning/home

Contest requirements:

1) Submit a picture of your Blueprint and a Video of your Rube Goldberg machine in action by July 26, 2020.
2) You may work in a group with others (family members encouraged to participate)
3) You must submit your entry into the category of the oldest student who participates (ex: if you have a 5th grade and 7th grader work together, the machine will be entered into the middle school category. Grades are determined by which grade you will be entering in the fall.
4) Winners will be announced on or before August 1, 2020.

post_id:
Dear SPS Families-

I hope everyone is doing well so far this summer! Just a brief email update on planning for the fall.

Attached, please find a document from the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education that is organized as an FAQ, and does a good job of covering a number of areas where people may have questions. The answers also give a clearer sense of the current thinking and guidelines from DESE that we are using in Stoughton to develop our plans for the fall. As the Commissioner describes, we are required to present three plans; full in-person learning with precautions, a hybrid model (both remote and in-person simultaneously), and a fully remote model. We have several teams working on those plans now. As mentioned in my last email, we'll be sending out a survey shortly to garner your feedback as well.

https://swift911v4-tx.swiftreach.com/Public/Email/AttachedFile.ashx?c=202900&j=73090628&l=0&e=c2cf91da-7aa9-4eae-bfe4-6b82d9822b1d&n=DESE+Reopening+FAQ+7-10.pdf&f=cb95f3d4-3581-4f3e-86c3-cecb5ac67eb3

Thank you all!

Dr. Marcus, Superintendent

post_text:
Check out the July SPS Rube Goldberg Challenge and Contest!
>>>>>>> master

Design a Rube-Goldberg Machine that uses multiple steps to complete a simple task. The basic concept that we’re exploring is that of a chain reaction. This open-ended challenge employs the engineering design process.

Get inspired, solve a problem, gather supplies, design and build your machine. Learn more here:

https://sites.google.com/stoughtonschools.org/spssummerlearning/home

Contest requirements:

1) Submit a picture of your Blueprint and a Video of your Rube Goldberg machine in action by July 26, 2020.
2) You may work in a group with others (family members encouraged to participate)
3) You must submit your entry into the category of the oldest student who participates (ex: if you have a 5th grade and 7th grader work together, the machine will be entered into the middle school category. Grades are determined by which grade you will be entering in the fall.
4) Winners will be announced on or before August 1, 2020.

Massachusetts state public health officials announced the 2020 season’s first EEE positive mosquito sample.

The best way to prevent EEE is to prevent attracting mosquitoes and mosquito bites. The recommendation is to wear long sleeved shirts, pants and socks when outdoors. Use a repellent with DEET, and remove all areas of standing water. If going to a town where EEE has been detected, avoid being outside from dusk until dawn whenever possible.

More information can be found on the websites below:
https://www.mass.gov/service-details/eee-eastern-equine-encephalitis
http://www.mosquitoresults.com/

Attention All Stoughton High School Graduates

Stoughton High School keeps cumulative records for students for 60 years after they graduate from SHS. Contents of the records are destroyed after 7 years with the exception of report cards and transcripts. If you are a graduate of the Class of 1960 or the class of 2013 and would like your records, please contact Mrs. Brauneis at the high school office at 781-344-7001 ext. 4109 before July 12, 2020.

Stoughton High School Class of 2020,

If you haven't yet, please read this letter from Principal Miller in regard to yearbooks and the Prom.

SHS would like to specifically recognize the following individuals and businesses for working with the Class of 2020 as they tried to plan for a Senior Prom.

- Liz from Simplistic Charm, Stoughton
- Francesca from Lombardos, Randolph
- Ihuoma from The Balloon Fairy, Stoughton
Thank you for your patience, cooperation, flexibility and utmost professionalism.

A quick update on the high school second phase. Construction is getting close to the finish line. The project team is working very hard in the final steps finishing the athletic fields, tennis courts, landscape/hardscape and Concession building, along with our Pearl Street park. Workers still maintain the strict guidelines regarding COVID safety. The pandemic has created some supply chain delays but there is no issue being operational for the start of the new school year. The pergola for the patio at the concession building will not arrive till August.

Here are some of the upcoming activities for the month of July at the construction site:

- High School entry install pre-cast benches and…

post_text:
Class of 2020 Special Education Students/Parents
>>>>>>> master

Congratulations Stoughton High School Class of 2020 Graduate! Before you head off on your next adventure we would like to ask that you pick up your special education records. These records contain a history of your special education services [copies of Individualized Education Programs (IEP’s), evaluation reports, progress reports, etc.] and can be useful to you in the future. To obtain your records please contact the Special Education office at (781) 344-7009.

Please be advised that School districts, in accordance with applicable state regulations, are required to destroy these materials seven years after the student transfers, graduates, or withdraws from the school system. Destruction of these records will begin on or after December 31, 2027.

Congratulations on your graduation and best wishes!
text:
Class of 2020 Special Education Students/Parents

Congratulations Stoughton High School Class of 2020 Graduate! Before you head off on your next adventure we would like to ask that you pick up your special education records. These records contain a history of your special education services [copies of Individualized Education Programs (IEP’s), evaluation reports, progress reports, etc.] and can be useful to you in the future. To obtain your records please contact the Special Education office at (781) 344-7009.

Please be advised that School districts, in accordance with applicable state regulations, are required to destroy these materials seven years after the student transfers, graduates, or withdraws from the school system. Destruction of these records will begin on or after December 31, 2027.

Congratulations on your graduation and best wishes!

post_text:
SUMMER NUTRITION PROGRAM at the O’DONNELL MIDDLE SCHOOL

The Stoughton Public Schools will be offering a Summer Nutrition Program at the Dr. Robert G. O’Donnell Middle School, at 211 Cushing Street in Stoughton, from Monday - Thursday, July 6 through August 6, 2020, free of charge, to all Stoughton children, 18 and under.

Children not enrolled in the summer educational program may pick up breakfast and lunch in front of the O'Donnell Middle School from 10:00 - 11:00 AM.

CDC regulations do not allow anyone that isn't associated with the educational summer program to enter the building. This is true for parents of the children at drop off and pick up, for the safety of our students…

CDC regulations do not allow anyone that isn't associated with the educational summer program to enter the building. This is true for parents of the children at drop off and pick up, for the safety of our students…

post_id:
Check out the July SPS Rube Goldberg Challenge and Contest!

Design a Rube-Goldberg Machine that uses multiple steps to complete a simple task. The basic concept that we’re exploring is that of a chain reaction. This open-ended challenge employs the engineering design process.

Get inspired, solve a problem, gather supplies, design and build your machine. Learn more here:

https://sites.google.com/stoughtonschools.org/spssummerlearning/home

Contest requirements:

1) Submit a picture of your Blueprint and a Video of your Rube Goldberg machine in action by July 26, 2020.
2) You may work in a group with others (family members encouraged to participate)
3) You must submit your entry into the category of the oldest student who participates (ex: if you have a 5th grade and 7th grader work together, the machine will be entered into the middle school category. Grades are determined by which grade you will be entering in the fall.
4) Winners will be announced on or before August 1, 2020.

The Town of Stoughton 2020 Annual Town Meeting will be held remotely today, Monday, June 29, 2020, and if needed, it will continue on Tuesday, June 30.

The public can watch Town Meeting live, thanks to Stoughton Media Access Corporation (SMAC) Television, on Comcast Channel 98 and Verizon Channel 24, and also on SMAC's website: http://www.stoughtontv.com at 7PM.

Here is documentation regarding Town Meeting: https://www.stoughton.org/town-manager/pages/town-meeting-annual-town-meeting-2020

The Stoughton Public Schools budget starts on page 124 in this document: https://www.stoughton.org/sites/stoughtonma/files/pages/atm2020_part_2.pdf

Attention All Stoughton High School Graduates

Stoughton High School keeps cumulative records for students for 60 years after they graduate from SHS. Contents of the records are destroyed after 7 years with the exception of report cards and transcripts. If you are a graduate of the Class of 1960 or the class of 2013 and would like your records, please contact Mrs. Brauneis at the high school office at 781-344-7001 ext. 4109 before July 12, 2020.

=======
200,0.0,https://scontent-atl3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/105554448_3426564830688283_6792460579524854582_o.png?_nc_cat=108&_nc_sid=8024bb&_nc_ohc=QjenoQ-TzWwAX9XfFWC&_nc_ht=scontent-atl3-1.xx&oh=3676f410ca5a679dd4edf4a67fa8cd06&oe=5F83C695,3.0,https://sites.google.com/stoughtonschools.org/spssummerlearning/home,3426585754019524,Check out the July SPS Rube Goldberg Challenge and Contest!

column1: Design a Rube-Goldberg Machine that uses multiple steps to complete a simple task. The basic concept that we’re exploring is that of a chain reaction. This open-ended challenge employs the engineering design process.

likes: design and build your machine. Learn more here:

column1: 1) Submit a picture of your Blueprint and a Video of your Rube Goldberg machine in action by July 26
2) You may work in a group with others (family members encouraged to participate)
3) You must submit your entry into the category of the oldest student who participates (ex: if you have a 5th grade and 7th grader work together
comments: the machine will be entered into the middle school category. Grades are determined by which grade you will be entering in the fall.

column1: 4) Winners will be announced on or before August 1
post_id:
Check out the July SPS Rube Goldberg Challenge and Contest!

Design a Rube-Goldberg Machine that uses multiple steps to complete a simple task. The basic concept that we’re exploring is that of a chain reaction. This open-ended challenge employs the engineering design process.

Get inspired, solve a problem, gather supplies, design and build your machine. Learn more here:

https://sites.google.com/stoughtonschools.org/spssummerlearning/home

Contest requirements:

1) Submit a picture of your Blueprint and a Video of your Rube Goldberg machine in action by July 26, 2020.
2) You may work in a group with others (family members encouraged to participate)
3) You must submit your entry into the category of the oldest student who participates (ex: if you have a 5th grade and 7th grader work together, the machine will be entered into the middle school category. Grades are determined by which grade you will be entering in the fall.
4) Winners will be announced on or before August 1, 2020.

post_text:
Fall Reopening Update

Dear SPS Community-

Yesterday, Governor Baker and Commissioner Riley of the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education released their initial guidance about reopening schools this fall. There has been a great amount of thought and care that went into the development of this guidance, and we share its goal of the safe return of as many students as possible to in-person school settings in order to best meet students’ academic, social, and emotional needs.

Yesterday's guidance provides much more clarity on expectations for school reopening around the Commonwealth. Over the coming days, our Reopening Working Groups will be reviewing the guidance to begin to…

Dear SPS Families-

Greetings on this warm summer day! I hope everyone is well! A couple of quick updates.

Pay and Ride Bus Transportation

In anticipation of students being back to school in the fall, we will once again be offering bus transportation for the 20-21 school year. In light of the current situation, we have made some changes to the process. Please note that, as our fall plans evolve, transportation routines may change.

The bus application is now online and can be accessed at stoughtontransportation.com. You will need to complete an application for each child in your family that will be riding the bus. Massachusetts General Law requires school departments to provide transportation for any student in Grades K – 6 living more than 2+ miles from their assigned school. This year, all…

An end of year Student Chrome Book return has been planned June 22- June 26, 2020. The collection process will keep everyone safe, socially-distanced while collecting the borrowed Chrome Book devices. The drive through Chrome Book Drop Off will be behind Stoughton High school. post_text:
Equity in Education and Social Justice Survey for Parents and Guardians

On Thursday, June 11, 2020, the elementary principal team hosted a parent/guardian forum to discuss ways to make our school environment actively inclusive, anti-racist and supportive of our students of color and other groups that have been marginalized in the past. They have designed this survey for parents and guardians that were unable to attend the forum or have more to add. The survey will help guide our action steps as a school leadership team in Stoughton Public Schools.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSevqQcDQPrubss_82tqZNbJ-0timt6hgabasapzSpqUgW5Ugg/viewform

post_text:
Stoughton High School Color Guard Registration Closes June 20, 2020

It’s time to begin assembling the 2020 SHS Marching Black Knights! The marching band is a competitive ensemble that meets after school during September and October. Membership is open to students in grades eight through twelve. This year the band will be performing BUENA ONDA, a show featuring Latin styles including the music of Carlos Santana, Joaquin Rodriguez, Chick Corea, Shakira and Jennifer Lopez! The band plans to compete in three circuits: The New England Scholastic Band Association, The Massachusetts Instrumental Choral Conductors Association, and the United States Band Association.

Joining the Band or Color Guard
text:
Stoughton High School Color Guard Registration Closes June 20, 2020

It’s time to begin assembling the 2020 SHS Marching Black Knights! The marching band is a competitive ensemble that meets after school during September and October. Membership is open to students in grades eight through twelve. This year the band will be performing BUENA ONDA, a show featuring Latin styles including the music of Carlos Santana, Joaquin Rodriguez, Chick Corea, Shakira and Jennifer Lopez! The band plans to compete in three circuits: The New England Scholastic Band Association, The Massachusetts Instrumental Choral Conductors Association, and the United States Band Association.

post_text:
The 2019-2020 school year has come to an end today, June 16, 2020. Heartfelt thanks to all of our students and families, teachers, staff, principals, and administrators for working so hard together during this unexpected and difficult year!
=======
You can see more of Mrs. Perry's videos here: https://www.facebook.com/dawe.school.artists/

The 2019-2020 school year has come to an end today, June 16, 2020. Heartfelt thanks to all of our students and families, teachers, staff, principals, and administrators for working so hard together during this unexpected and difficult year!
>>>>>>> master

We will update everyone about summer learning, dates of summer activities, food options, and what the plan will be for the next school year over the summer. Please watch our social media and check your email for updates.

We invite you and your family to share photos of your summer learning experiences on our Facebook page. Email them with line or two of text to info@stoughtonschools.org, and we will try to post as many as we can.

Stay safe and well.
text:
The 2019-2020 school year has come to an end today, June 16, 2020. Heartfelt thanks to all of our students and families, teachers, staff, principals, and administrators for working so hard together during this unexpected and difficult year!

We will update everyone about summer learning, dates of summer activities, food options, and what the plan will be for the next school year over the summer. Please watch our social media and check your email for updates.

We invite you and your family to share photos of your summer learning experiences on our Facebook page. Email them with line or two of text to info@stoughtonschools.org, and we will try to post as many as we can.

Stay safe and well.

FRI, JUN 26
SPS Chromebook Returns

post_text:
Dear SPS Community-

As we head into the last day of this incredible school year, a year that I had said would be a year of New Beginnings, I would like to leave you with a few thoughts.

We may well look back on 2020 even in a few years and just sigh deeply and say, wow! While the word “unprecedented” has been used a lot, it is truly an apt description. However, amidst this tough time, I have to say that our students are amazing! If you scroll back through web sites and social media over the last few months you will see our students writing, creating art, connecting with friends, debating in class, taking on community service projects, sending messages of hope, and simply persevering. … More

post_text:
Pay and Ride Bus Transportation

In anticipation of students being back to school in the fall, we will once again be offering bus transportation for the 20-21 school year. In light of the current situation, we have made some changes to the process. Please note that, as our fall plans evolve, transportation routines may change.

The bus application is now online and can be accessed at stoughtontransportation.com. You will need to complete an application for each child in your family that will be riding the bus. Massachusetts General Law requires school departments to provide transportation for any student in Grades K – 6 living more than 2+ miles from their assigned school. This year, all…

post_text: The O'Donnell Middle School is proud to announce that two students have once again won prizes in the Arson Watch Rewards Program Fire Safety Poster Contest. Jalisiyah Peddy won the 2nd Place Prize for Norfolk County and Jailyn Carey won 1st Place Prize for Norfolk County and the 3rd Place Prize for the entire state of Massachusetts. The state win also awards a $1000 grant to the Stoughton Fire Department. Thank you to Deputy Chief Scott Breen, SFD, who came into Mrs. Jarasitis's art classroom in February to kick off the poster contest and inform students about the importance of fire prevention. Also thanks to the Stoughton Fire Department for bringing us this poster contest and supporting us with fire prevention education every year!

The state win also awards a $1000 grant to the Stoughton Fire Department. post_text:
Attention All Stoughton High School Graduates
>>>>>>> master

Stoughton High School keeps cumulative records for students for 60 years after they graduate from SHS. Contents of the records are destroyed after 7 years with the exception of report cards and transcripts. If you are a graduate of the Class of 1960 or the class of 2013 and would like your records, please contact Mrs. Brauneis at the high school office at 781-344-7001 ext. 4109 before July 12, 2020.
text:
Attention All Stoughton High School Graduates

Stoughton High School keeps cumulative records for students for 60 years after they graduate from SHS. Contents of the records are destroyed after 7 years with the exception of report cards and transcripts. If you are a graduate of the Class of 1960 or the class of 2013 and would like your records, please contact Mrs. Brauneis at the high school office at 781-344-7001 ext. 4109 before July 12, 2020.

O'Donnell Middle School Virtual Class Day 2020

Dear SPS Community,

An end of year Student Chrome Book return has been planned June 22- June 26, 2020. The collection process will keep everyone safe, socially-distanced while collecting the borrowed Chrome Book devices. The drive through Chrome Book Drop Off will be behind Stoughton High school. We ask that you don't get out of your car. Families should plan to return Chrome Book devices and power cables at one of the times listed below. Reservations are not needed, just drive up!

post_text: Mrs. Catrambone's class, from the Gibbons School. was able to go on a field trip to paint pottery in early March. Before the trip, students learned vocabulary and worked on map skills and social skills as related to the functional field trip. During remote learning, Mrs. Catrambone and service providers dropped off "pottery to go" kits to the students' homes and they were able to make connections and complete a mug painted in Stoughton school colors. Thank you to the Goddard Foundation and Gibbons School PTO for funding these amazing experiences. A special thank you to Pea Poddery in Cumberland, RI for being so accommodating with our Gibbons Group!

post_text:
Help with P-EBT Cards:

Families whose students qualify for free or reduced-price lunch started to receive P-EBT cards in the mail on Friday, May 29, and many are having trouble activating their card. To activate (or PIN) a P-EBT card, families will need the letter that the Department of Transitional Assistance (DTA) sent them, which contains their child’s case number. If families lost the letter or never received one, they can go to DTAConnect.com/pebt to get their child’s case number. The tool at that link will pre-populate with the standard first 10 digits of the P-EBT card. Please note that the tool is not available on the DTA Connect mobile app.

Families that have their child’s case…

TODAY! Stoughton parents told OASIS that motivation (to do schoolwork, to keep physically active, to maintain a routine, etc.) has been a challenge for students and adults alike. OASIS is VERY lucky to have the opportunity to "bring" Kikkan Randall, recent olympic gold medalist, cancer survivor and mom to share her lessons learned in keeping motivated. Her inspiring talk is appropriate for students (ages 7 and up) and adults - it would be a great thing to do as a family on Thursday evening!

>>>>>>> master

PARENTS AND GUARDIANS: Does it feel like Groundhog Day in your house yet? Each day a fresh chorus of “I’m bored!” and “I miss my friends!” and perhaps even “ I miss school” (gasp!). Do you find yourself losing track of what time it is, what day it is? Are your eyes getting bleary from binge-watching or lost in FB land? Let’s all hang out together in our collective misery to find support, comfort and laughter. Support groups have no obligations and no expectations except treating each other with tolerance and respect. Show up as you are - stay as long as you like. Drop in to our free, virtual support group for a safe space to connect with peers, moderated by a licensed mental health professional.

Teresa Tapper, LMHC, is the Senior Clinician at the Stoughton Youth Commission. Call 781-341-2252, x9453 (to leave a voicemail)
text:

post_text:
Pay and Ride Bus Transportation

In anticipation of students being back to school in the fall, we will once again be offering bus transportation for the 20-21 school year. In light of the current situation, we have made some changes to the process. Please note that, as our fall plans evolve, transportation routines may change.

The bus application is now online and can be accessed at stoughtontransportation.com. You will need to complete an application for each child in your family that will be riding the bus. Massachusetts General Law requires school departments to provide transportation for any student in Grades K – 6 living more than 2+ miles from their assigned school. This year, all…

Dawe School Dragon Families and Friends,

The Dawe Staff and I put together this video in order to thank you for all of your hard work and support during this extended school closure. We are extremely appreciative of how our school community came together during such uncertain times to best support our Dawe Dragons and their education. We hope you enjoy the video!

Thank you for everything!

Sincerely, Mr. Cancellieri

post_text:
Good Evening SPS Community-

I hope everyone is well on this last full week of school. Just a few days left…

This week, I have read a ton, listened to students and alumni, and have spoken directly to many of you about the important work happening and to come in our district. As mentioned in my recent video, we are committed to the work of strengthening our efforts for anti-racist, pro-tolerance environments for our children. As suggested by community members and students, secondary principals are developing safe spaces for students to share their questions and concerns, while elementary principals are working on a forum for parents to share their own questions and ideas about how to talk… More

Stoughton parents told OASIS that motivation (to do schoolwork, to keep physically active, to maintain a routine, etc.) has been a challenge for students and adults alike. OASIS is VERY lucky to have the opportunity to "bring" Kikkan Randall, recent olympic gold medalist, cancer survivor and mom to share her lessons learned in keeping motivated. Her inspiring talk is appropriate for students (ages 7 and up) and adults - it would be a great thing to do as a family on Thursday evening!

post_text:
Help with P-EBT Cards:

Families whose students qualify for free or reduced-price lunch started to receive P-EBT cards in the mail on Friday, May 29, and many are having trouble activating their card. To activate (or PIN) a P-EBT card, families will need the letter that the Department of Transitional Assistance (DTA) sent them, which contains their child’s case number. If families lost the letter or never received one, they can go to DTAConnect.com/pebt to get their child’s case number. The tool at that link will pre-populate with the standard first 10 digits of the P-EBT card. Please note that the tool is not available on the DTA Connect mobile app.

Families that have their child’s case…

In partnership with WGBH, Governor Charlie Baker will deliver a commencement address to the Class of 2020 as part of a celebration for graduating seniors from 668 public and private schools across the Commonwealth, to be aired in a special broadcast at 7:30 p.m. today, Tuesday, June 9, 2020.

The address will be on WGBH-TV Ch. 2, simulcast on Channels 4, 5, 7, 10, 25, 57, NECN, Telemundo and social media, 7:30 p.m.

Massachusetts Commencement 2020 will feature congratulatory remarks from Jason and Devin McCourty of the New England Patriots, members of the Red Sox and the Boston Celtics, and a number of celebrities with Massachusetts ties, including singer Rachel Platten, actor Steve Carell…

The Stoughton Town Election is today, Tuesday, June 9, 2020 from 7 am to 8 pm.

Here is a video explaining how voting will be in order to protect everyone during the pandemic: https://youtu.be/8QAPebekaEs

Here are the voting locations:

Precinct 1 votes at the Dawe Elementary School, 131 Pine St.
Precinct 2 votes at the Jones Elementary School, 137 Walnut St.
Precinct 3 votes at the South Elementary School, 171 Ash St.
Precincts 4 and 5 vote at the Gibbons Elementary School, 235 Morton St.
Precinct 6 votes at the Hansen Elementary School, 1800 Central St.
Precinct 7 votes at the West Elementary School, 1322 Central St.
Precinct 8 votes at the O’Donnell Middle School, 211 Cushing St.

Sample ballots can be seen here: https://www.stoughton.org/sites/stoughtonma/files/uploads/sample_ballot.pdf

Voting information is available here: https://www.stoughton.org/town-clerk/pages/voting-information

Note: Please do not comment about candidates on this page. This is not the place to do so. If comments are posted, they will be removed.

link:
Stoughton resident, Michael LaFLeur, runs by the Stoughton High School construction site everyday with his flag, and loves seeing the great progress made. He sent us this photo (and we added two more) of the old 1920's SHS concrete sign that's been installed one the side of the new field house building. 🇺🇸✌

The 1920's SHS concrete sign is from the original A Building that was taken down (gently) and is now placed. There is another relief that was taken from the building that will be incorporated in another spot later in July. We'll share photos when we have them.

K - 5 ELEMENTARY REGISTRATION SCHOOL YEAR 2020/2021

Beginning the week of June 8, 2020, our elementary schools will begin processing registration paperwork for the fall.

If you need a packet please contact the school and one will be mailed to you.

When your registration packet is complete, please send it back to the school in one of these ways:

- Scan and email to the school secretary (see email addresses below)
- Drop off your packet in a sealed envelope in the box located at the front door (available between 8-3 only)
- Mail to the school

We cannot process your packet until it is complete. Please provide copies, not originals, of any required paperwork.

Thank you for your patience and…

post_text:
A message for Lucan Curtis-Mahoney, SHS Class of 2020, from his family:
>>>>>>> master

“If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.” - H. D. Thoreau

Lucan, it takes great courage to hear your own music, create your unique path, and remain true to your convictions. We’re proud of you. We love you.

End of Year Update for Elementary Families

Dear Parents/Guardians:

We hope that you are well! The following information is important and will hopefully answer any questions you have about the end of the year. This year will be different than years past due to our school buildings being closed and the need for social distancing. Our plan puts the safety of our community at the forefront.

Important Upcoming Dates:

Monday, May 25th Memorial Day (No School)

Tuesday, May 27th-Friday, May 29th - District-wide Virtual Field Day

Friday, June 5th 12:00 - Kindergarten families will pick up student belongings (anything from the student’s desk/ cubby) and certificate

Monday, June 8th 12:00- 2:00 Grade 1…

TODAY! “Talk and Tea with Teresa” for Parents/Guardians. This Virtual Support Group is on THURSDAYS at 4pm. RSVP by calling 781-341-2252 X9453 or via email at ttapper@stoughtonma.gov.
>>>>>>> master

PARENTS AND GUARDIANS: Does it feel like Groundhog Day in your house yet? Each day a fresh chorus of “I’m bored!” and “I miss my friends!” and perhaps even “ I miss school” (gasp!). Do you find yourself losing track of what time it is, what day it is? Are your eyes getting bleary from binge-watching or lost in FB land? Let’s all hang out together in our collective misery to find support, comfort and laughter. Support groups have no obligations and no expectations except treating each other with tolerance and respect. Show up as you are - stay as long as you like. Drop in to our free, virtual support group for a safe space to connect with peers, moderated by a licensed mental health professional.

Teresa Tapper, LMHC, is the Senior Clinician at the Stoughton Youth Commission. Call 781-341-2252, x9453 (to leave a voicemail)
text:

post_text:
Here is an update from Stoughton High School Class of 2020 Officers to the Seniors 🖤 🧡:

Hello all! Hope everyone is doing well and excited for Graduation soon! We can’t wait to see you all (virtually, of course).

After many meetings with our advisors and Ms. Miller, Prom will take place at Stoughton High School on Thursday, August 6, 2020, if CDC guidelines allow us to. 🎊It will be FREE of admission, and feel free to dress as fancy or as casual as you like!👗👖We really hope everyone can be there and enjoy this fun and memorable night together!

We will post more information as soon as more decisions are finalized. In the mean time, enjoy your summer seniors!☀️

If you have any questions or concerns, please don’t hesitate to reach out to one of the officers. Contact/DM us, and we’d be happy to talk!😊

See you all soon & stay safe!

Jasmine, Leah, Henenda & Beyonce

One of the events everyone looks forward to each year are the Graduating Class walks through their Elementary Schools. This year, the former schools made amazing touching and creative videos for the Class of 2020. They are a really special tribute to the graduates and show all the love, support, and congratulations that their former teachers hold for for them. Enjoy!

post_text:
The Stoughton Town Election is Tuesday, June 9, 2020 from 7 am to 8 pm.

Here is a video explaining how voting will be in order to protect everyone during the pandemic: https://youtu.be/8QAPebekaEs

Here are the voting locations:

Precinct 1 votes at the Dawe Elementary School, 131 Pine St.
Precinct 2 votes at the Jones Elementary School, 137 Walnut St.
Precinct 3 votes at the South Elementary School, 171 Ash St.
Precincts 4 and 5 vote at the Gibbons Elementary School, 235 Morton St.
Precinct 6 votes at the Hansen Elementary School, 1800 Central St.
Precinct 7 votes at the West Elementary School, 1322 Central St.
Precinct 8 votes at the O’Donnell Middle School, 211 Cushing St.

Voting information is available here: https://www.stoughton.org/town-clerk/pages/voting-information

Absentee Ballot Application information is here: https://www.stoughton.org/home/news/absentee-ballot-application

Note: Please do not comment about candidates on this page. This is not the place to do so. If comments are posted, they will be removed.

post_text:
O'Donnell Middle School Student Item Pick Up & Return

Starting on June 8, 2020, students and parents/guardians will be able to start coming to OMS to pick up their belongings and return school-issued materials. Students and their parents/guardians will sign up for a ten minute appointment, using the Sign Up Genius links below.

6th and 7th graders will be able to choose their ten minute appointment slots on June 8, 10, 11, or 12th between the hours of 8am and 2pm.

8th graders will choose a ten minute appointment on June 15th or 16th between the hours of 8am and 2pm.

All students must be accompanied by an adult.

All visitors will park and use the gymnasium entrance on the side of the…

This week ONLY Breakfast/Lunch Pick-Up is available at the O'Donnell Middle School from 10-11:30am on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday. We’d like to remind folks that we are trying to reduce contacts so please pop your trunk or an electronic back door if possible. We can also drop bags into a rear side window.

More info is available here:

https://www.stoughtonschools.org/covid-19-updates/pages/food-resources

Please share this with friends and families who may not know this information.

post_text: There will be a small crew working on the Stoughton High School site tomorrow, Saturday, May 23, 2020. They will start the morning work near the baseball fields opposite the Wilkins School, and then head over mid-morning to the corner of Pearl and Adams. Work includes fine grading the tennis courts and D-Zone of the track.

column1: PARENTS AND GUARDIANS: Does it feel like Groundhog Day in your house yet? Each day a fresh chorus of “I’m bored!” and “I miss my friends!” and perhaps even “ I miss school” (gasp!). Do you find yourself losing track of what time it is

post_url:
TODAY! “Talk and Tea with Teresa” for Parents/Guardians. This Virtual Support Group is on THURSDAYS at 4pm. RSVP by calling 781-341-2252 X9453 or via email at ttapper@stoughtonma.gov.

PARENTS AND GUARDIANS: Does it feel like Groundhog Day in your house yet? Each day a fresh chorus of “I’m bored!” and “I miss my friends!” and perhaps even “ I miss school” (gasp!). Do you find yourself losing track of what time it is, what day it is? Are your eyes getting bleary from binge-watching or lost in FB land? Let’s all hang out together in our collective misery to find support, comfort and laughter. Support groups have no obligations and no expectations except treating each other with tolerance and respect. Show up as you are - stay as long as you like. Drop in to our free, virtual support group for a safe space to connect with peers, moderated by a licensed mental health professional.

Teresa Tapper, LMHC, is the Senior Clinician at the Stoughton Youth Commission. Call 781-341-2252, x9453 (to leave a voicemail)

shared_text:
Congratulations to Stoughton High School Alumn, Catherine Foley, from the Class of 2006, who is on Bakeaway Camp with Martha Stewart on the Food Network on Mondays at 9pm.

If you want to catch up on the show, you can see it here: https://www.foodnetwork.com/shows/bakeaway-camp/episodes

"Originally from Stoughton, she knew Worcester before going to Holy Cross because an uncle taught at the college and the family would often visit him in here. “It’s a city that’s near and dear to me,” Foley said.

Foley graduated from Holy Cross with a degree in French with a concentration in peace and conflict studies, and went on to earn master’s degrees from the University of St. Andrews and the University of Edinburgh, both in Scotland. She is now a senior consultant in energy security with Deloitte, and lives with her husband in Washington, D.C." Read more: https://www.metrowestdailynews.com/entertainmentlife/20200516/holy-cross-grad-among-contestants-in-martha-stewart-baking-tv-show

The U.S. Census Bureau has extended the deadline for the national census to Saturday, October 31, 2020. Individuals can respond at http://2020Census.gov, over the phone by calling the number in the invitation that was mailed to their home, or by mail.

To find out the response rate in a particular area, consult this spreadsheet that tracks responses in all Massachusetts towns/cities and census tracts (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__docs.google.com_spreadsheets_d_1q71v09oYTUrNDMqyyYmUsABXceicAUGQUTLNTHQLcu0_edit-3Fusp-3Dsharing&d=DwMFaQ&c=lDF7oMaPKXpkYvev9V-fVahWL0QWnGCCAfCDz1Bns_w&r=v9StZvZHyaLld7OqtaYjH2bIADu7yUyE0reg14HHbEw&…

Good Morning Class of 2020,
>>>>>>> master

Please read the important information below on how you will get your Cap, Gown and Stole.

Cap, Gown, and Stole Pick-Up
- Caps, Gowns, and Stoles are free to all seniors this year.
- Caps, Gowns, and Stoles may be picked up on Tuesday, May 12th and Thursday May 14th from 10:00 am - 12:00 pm
- Curbside Pick-Up will occur in the bus lane (behind the high school).
- Please enter the high school parking lot from Adams Street and enter the bus lane. You will see Staff there.
- Give your name and your Cap, Gown and Stole will be given to you. If you are also a member of good standing in NHS, NBHS, NAHS or DECA you will also receive your cords.
- You will also be given some written information regarding how you will proceed in taking a picture and providing me with information to include in the virtual portion of our graduation ceremony.
- If you are unable to report to the high school to pick-up your cap and gown, please email Ms. Miller to make alternative arrangements.
Parents/Guardians may pick-up for you as well.

Be Well,
Ms Miller

post_text:
Dear Class of 2020 and Families:

First and foremost, congratulations to each and every one of you reaching this very exciting point in your life! No matter what, we are incredibly proud of the Class of 2020 for what they have brought to SHS and to the town of Stoughton.

It is difficult to put into words the challenges we have faced over the course of the past seven weeks and the sense of loss and disappointment many of our students feel, especially our seniors. Typically, at this point in the school year, our seniors are overwhelmed with excitement and anticipation for all of the culminating activities: Athletic Awards, Class Night, Spring Play, Prom, Scholarship Knight and of course,…

This morning Kelsea, Kaylee, and Julianna dropped off Panera bagels and muffins at the DPW to thank them for always being there for the town and for everything they do.

They are all done collecting donations. Tomorrow is their last drop off.

post_text:
Save the date!

"Graduate Together: America Honors the High School Class of 2020" will be a 1-hour multimedia event featuring several guests, and it will air on Saturday, May 16, 2020 at 8pm on ABC, CBS, FOX and NBC as well as other broadcast and digital streaming partners, according to a press release.

Special guests will include LeBron James, Malala Yousafzai, the Jonas Brothers, Yara Shahidi, Bad Bunny, Lena Waithe, Pharrell Williams, Megan Rapinoe, H.E.R. and Ben Platt, and the event is being hosted by XQ Institute, The LeBron James Family Foundation and The Entertainment Industry Foundation.

Read more about this here: https://abcnews.go.com/US/barack-obama-giving-high-school-commencement-speech-class/story?id=70512666

Victor, in grade 6 group A at the O'Donnell Middle School, would like to thank all his teachers and the staff at OMS. His parents allso say thank you for the work you do all year and especially now during this unusual time.

Thank you to our wonderful teachers; Mrs. Kendra Murphy Dawe School, grade four and Miss Carter and the staff at the Jones Preschool. We appreciate all you do...love Mia and Mikey.

Thank you to our amazing Gibbons and Jones teachers!!! We love and miss you!!

- - -

If you would like your pictures to be included, please email them to info@stoughtonschools.org before noon on Friday May 8th. We’ll be posting submissions daily.

Include the name of your school, and the person or group of people who you are showing your appreciation for. Feel free to include your student's first name and grade as well.

You can also send notes directly to your teacher anytime during this week.

Remember every act will be greatly appreciated by our hardworking staff,. Please reach out anyway you feel comfortable!

On March 14th and March 15th Stoughton High School HOSA members competed in a statewide competition in a number of health field related events. This is the first year that SHS has a HOSA chapter. Over 25 students from SHS competed in events. We were just notified that some of our students placed as top scores in the competition. We are very pleased to announce the names of our members who placed and qualified for the National Conference (virtual).
>>>>>>> master

Here is a list of SHS students who were awarded recognition:

Medical Assisting: Kate Francis, Kate placed 2nd
Biomedical Lab Science Erik Teodoro, placed 2nd
Clinical Nursing Bridget O'Malley, placed 3rd
Nursing Assisting: Ingrid Santos Lima, placed 2nd
Nutrition: Danielle Marrocco, placed 3rd

Congratulations everyone!
text:
On March 14th and March 15th Stoughton High School HOSA members competed in a statewide competition in a number of health field related events. This is the first year that SHS has a HOSA chapter. Over 25 students from SHS competed in events. We were just notified that some of our students placed as top scores in the competition. We are very pleased to announce the names of our members who placed and qualified for the National Conference (virtual).

Here is a list of SHS students who were awarded recognition:

Medical Assisting: Kate Francis, Kate placed 2nd
Biomedical Lab Science Erik Teodoro, placed 2nd
Clinical Nursing Bridget O'Malley, placed 3rd
Nursing Assisting: Ingrid Santos Lima, placed 2nd
Nutrition: Danielle Marrocco, placed 3rd

Congratulations everyone!

post_text:
Following is the current Stoughton High School construction status as of May 5, 2020:
>>>>>>> master

Manpower is 35-40. They continue to follow COVID strict guidelines on site.

The turf installer is expected to start installation around May 25th.
The asphalt has been stripped at the entrance of new high school, and the prepping of the sidewalk and paver installation has begun.
Football field perimeter nailer is ongoing.
Electrical trenching continues for lighting poles
Concession Building roofing truss work is near completion.
Site grading for future Tennis court is completed.
Curb cut on Pearl Street completed.
Bleacher installation is ongoing.
The press box is being installed.
Form work for future sidewalks continues.
Irrigation system will be scheduled for testing shortly.
Fencing installation for athletic field has commenced.
Trench drain installation is ongoing throughout athletic fields.

post_text: Today the girls delivered Panera breakfast to the Stoughton Post Office. These essential men and women are delivering our mail everyday no matter what the circumstances are. Thank you for all you do to make sure everyone in Stoughton gets their mail everyday. The girls have one more stop tomorrow and are getting very close to being able to add another place to their list. If anyone would like to donate please reach out.
